Mourning

Fifteen years ago, in April of 1989, thousands gathered in Tiananmen Square (天安門) to mourn the death of Former Party General Secretary Hu Yaobang (胡耀邦), sparking off one of the most important political movements in recent Chinese history. This was not the first time that public mourning had been used as a means of political dissent. In April of ...
